Label.text: Data binding is a mechanism that allows a user interface element to connect with a business logic object.
Changes made to the element are automatically reflected in the business object, and changes made to the business object are automatically reflected in the element.
When data bound, business logic objects are typicaly referred to as the source, and UI elements are considered the target or destination.

Flow of data between a source and target can be one-way or two-way. In one-way data binding, data flows in a single direction (from source to target, where updates to the source are reflected in the target, but target updates do not flow to the source). In two-way, data flows bi-directionally, and both source and target are automatically kept in sync.
NativeScript supports both one-way and two-way data binding.
